text: the homeless population has exploded in

suffering
on honestly every street corner in

let's take a look at the numbers
the los angeles times examined more than
4 000 questionnaires taken as part of
2019's point in time count and found
that about 76 percent of individuals
living outside on the streets reported
being or were observed to be
affected by mental illness substance
abuse poor health or a physical

get a little more specific individually
substance abuse affects 46 of those

stress disorder affects 51 of those

analysis
and as we've shared on the show before
the number of drug overdoses has also

and uh these numbers i'm about to share

they're from 2019

have been the leading cause of death

since 2017
increasing 84
between 2016 and 2019. according to the

this is real this is happening but for

ignoring this problem doesn't make it go

people don't come to live here if they

so there's definitely a housing part of

stage
addiction and untreated mental illness
to suggest that they're on the street

people who can't afford the rent as you

state
or moved into a lower rent apartment or

illness ended up on the street
and i and look i

everybody wants to see a treatment first

for everybody who wants one
at a cost of around 750 000 to a million

that's been shown by the reality on the

you don't have to be a dogmatic

the cost is just too high
california is lucky to be the fifth

fel uh fellow uh you know friends and

hhh
